The claim was based on a single: since deleted) tweet and a months-old screenshot, which lacked evidence to support the hacking of Parler.
The tweet by: Kevinabosch, which initially spread the rumor, has been known to share inaccurate claims on social media before.
The screenshot that circulated as proof: well before the alleged hacking incident in November 2020. It was also from an old WordPress installation of Parler and did not contain any user data.
Parler CEO John Matze explicitly denied: No evidence has been found to support the claim that user data, including Social Security numbers or private messages, were hacked from Parler.
